title: Verify - Verify NHL.TV app icon successfully displays on Apple TV Home Menu
custom_preconds: User has installed the app
custom_steps:
1. Scroll though the Apple TV Home Menu items and locate the NHL.TV app
2. Observe the art/logo
custom_expected: NHL.TV app displays approved NHL logo/art

title: Verify - NHL.TV app icon can be moved about the home screen
custom_preconds: NHL.TV has been installed on the device
custom_steps:
1. Hold the Select button on the remote to put the app icons into a move state.
2. Move and drop the app icon to various positions on the home screen.
custom_expected: NHL.TV app displays approved NHL logo/art and holds any new position on screen.

title: Verify - Verify that NHL top shelf image displays when NHL.TV app is placed on the top shelf
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV has been installed on the device
NHL.TV app icon has been placed on the Top Shelf of the Apple TV home menu
custom_steps:
1. Select the NHL.TV app icon 
2. Observe
custom_expected: NHL art/photography is displayed as the Top Shelf image

title: Verify -  Wired Connection: Selecting NHL.TV app icon successfully opens the app
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV has been installed on the device
The ATV device has wired connection
custom_steps: 1. Launch the app
custom_expected: NHL.TV app will launch and user will be taken into the app

title: Verify - Wi-Fi Connection: Selecting NHL.TV app icon successfully opens the app
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV has been installed on the device
The ATV device has an active Wi-Fi connection
custom_steps: 1. Launch the app
custom_expected: NHL.TV app will launch and user will be taken into the app

title: Verify - Not Connected - On initial launch, user is presented with IAP options
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app has been installed onto the device
User has not yet launched or signed into the app
custom_steps: 1. Launch app
custom_expected: Sign in, Restore, Paywall and Skip options appear and are properly functional.

title: Verify - IAP - Order of IAP SKUs is Yearly | Monthly
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app has been installed onto the device
User has not yet launched or signed into the app
custom_steps: 1. Launch app
custom_expected:
.TV team confirmed the order they want is:
Yearly | Monthly

Listed SKUs should appear as such.

title: Verify - Not Connected - Verify that the correct branding is displayed (Rogers/NHL.TV)
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app has been installed onto the device
User has not yet launched or signed into the app
Have Canadian iTunes and U.S. iTunes accounts
custom_steps:
1. Log in with U.S. or Canadian iTunes account
2. Launch app
custom_expected:
Depending on which iTunes account is logged in, the correct branding should be shown:
U.S. account - NHL.TV
Canada - Rogers Gamecentre

title: Verify - Login - Existing user Login
custom_preconds: App installed
custom_steps:
1. Select "Existing User? Log In"
2. Enter valid login credentials
custom_expected: User can properly login with either their NHL.TV or Rogers GameCentre account

title: Verify - Restore Purchase from iTunes
custom_preconds:
App installed
User account that has already completed IAP at a previous time
custom_steps:
1. Select "Restore Purchase from iTunes"
2. Choose (or enter in) the account for testing
3. Enter in credentials
custom_expected: If you have purchased one of the skus previously, say on another tvOS device or on your iPhone, restore purchase should take you through apple's flow for restoring that purchase and giving you access accordingly

title: Verify - Favorite Teams - User can set their Favorite teams and Follow other teams
custom_preconds:
App loaded and launched
User has either logged in or skipped login
custom_steps:
1. Scroll through the list of teams
2. Click on a team logo
3. Select one of the available options
custom_expected:
FTUE message will appear advising users that "Favoriting or Following a team changes the order of your scoreboard and will sync with your other devices."
Users can opt to Favorite a team, Follow a team or Cancel.
Favorited teams appear in the "Favorites" section of the sidebar (Favorited teams will be marked with a star in the corner of the logo)
Followed teams will appear in the "Followed" section of the sidebar

title: Verify - Hide Scores
custom_preconds:
App loaded and launched
User has either logged in or skipped login
custom_steps:
1. Proceed past Team follow/favorite
2. Hide Scores setting appears
custom_expected:
- User is able to select hide scores form the settings menu
- Hide scores, if tuned ON, will hide scores from all games (Live and VOD)
- Hide scores, if tuned ON, will hide scores from Extended Highlight and Game Recap titles

title: Verify - Page displays setting to set notification/alert preferences to On or Off
custom_preconds:
App loaded and launched
User has either logged in or skipped login
custom_steps: 1. Click on the highlighted Notifications button and click the remote button
custom_expected:
Notification setting can be toggled to ON and OFF by clicking on the remote.
This setting will save properly, and persist unless changed in Settings.

title: Verify - Next and Skip - Verify that "Next" and "Skip" work as intended
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app has been installed onto the device
User has not yet launched or signed into the app
custom_steps: 1. Select the "Skip" option at the bottom of the page
custom_expected:
Clicking the "Skip" button will skip whichever page the user is currently on.
Clicking "Next" will advance the user to the next page of the onboarding.

title: Verify - Page displays setting to set notification/alert preferences to On or Off
custom_preconds:
App loaded and launched
User has either logged in or skipped login
custom_steps: 1. Click on the highlighted Notifications button and click the remote button
custom_expected: Notification setting can be toggled to ON and OFF by clicking on the remote

title: Verify - Page displays "Save" option
custom_preconds:
App loaded and launched
User has either logged in or skipped login
custom_steps:
1. Toggle the Notification setting
2. Click the Save button
custom_expected: Verify that notification setting modifications are saved after setting them and finalizing with Save button.

title: Verify - Page details which game states will appear in notifications/alerts
Verify - Page displays image example of feature in action
Verify - Alerts/Notification settings can be changed in the app settings post-onboarding
Verify - Alerts correctly display details of game/event
custom_preconds:
• App installed
• Have some teams favorited or followed
• Notifications set to "ON"
custom_steps:
1. Start a game stream that overlaps the time when the game of a favorited/followed team starts
2. Watch game until game of a favorited/followed team gets close to starting 
3. Observe alert that appears
custom_expected: Correct teams and details of notification appear correctly

title: Verify - Alerts appear in the correct part of the screen
custom_preconds:
• App installed
• Have some teams favorited or followed
• Notifications set to "ON"
custom_steps:
1. Start a game stream that overlaps the time when the game of a favorited/followed team starts
2. Watch game until game of a favorited/followed team gets close to starting
3. Observe alert that appears
custom_expected:
Game alerts appear towards the top right-hand corner of the screen.

title: Verify - NHL.TV: Verify tab menu categories display as expected
custom_preconds:
IF app has been installed
AND has been launched
custom_steps:
1. Launch the NHL.TV app
2. Bypass the Welcome Screen if first launch
custom_expected:
If User has not logged in:
THEN users sees 4 categories at the top of the screen in following order left to right:
Scores
Video
Standings
Settings

If User has logged in:
THEN users sees 4 categories at the top of the screen in following order left to right:
Scores
Video
Standings
Settings


NHL.TV Logo appears in the upper right corner

title: Verify - Rogers Game Center: Verify tab menu and categories display as expected
custom_preconds:
IF app has been installed
AND has been launched
custom_steps:
Launch the NHL.TV app
Bypass the Welcome Screen if first launch
custom_expected:
If User has not logged in:
THEN user sees at right of screen 5 categories in following order top to bottom:
Scores
Teams
Standings
Buy Rogers NHL GameCentre LIVE™
Settings

If User has logged in:
THEN user sees at right of screen 4 categories in following order top to bottom:
Scores
Teams
Standings
Settings

Rogers GameCenter LIVE Logo appears in the upper right corner
Team logos will display and cycle through each team on the left side
If first Launch, ensure the Welcome Message is displayed

Rogers GameCenter Logo appears in the upper right corner
Team logos will display and cycle through each team on the left side
If first Launch, ensure the Welcome Message is displayed

title: Verify - Scores: Launching score will take the user to the correct date and will display today's schedule
custom_preconds: NHL.TV app has been installed
custom_steps:
1. Launch the NHL.TV App
2. Select "Scores" from the main menu
custom_expected:
- The user should be taken to the correct date and the scheduled games for that day should appear.
- Make sure to scroll through the list of each game for that day and ensure the correct team logo appears
- Ensure the correct time is displayed
- Ensure the scores are displayed if enabled

title: Verify - Scores: Today's game navigation
custom_preconds: NHL.TV app has been installed
custom_steps:
1. Launch the NHL.TV App
2. Select Scores from the main menu
custom_expected:
- User will be taken to the correct date
- Correct schedule of games is displayed
- Each tile displays team logo
- When specific tile is highlighted, the correct team logos are displayed in the tile
- Correct text appears according to teams that are playing

title: Verify - Scores: Date Navigation
custom_preconds: NHL.TV app has been installed
custom_steps:
1. Launch the NHL.TV app
2. Select Scores from the main menu
3. Press Left or Right on the remote
4. Click the Left or Right arrows on the remote
5. Highlight and click the current date
custom_expected:
- Pressing Right on the controller highlights the Right arrow for navigation to other dates
- Clicking the Arrow moves screen one page to the Right
- Pressing Left on the controller highlights the Left arrow for navigation to other dates
- Clicking the Arrow moves screen one page to the Left
- Highlight and clicking on the date brings up the Calendar view
- The games according to the schedule are correctly displayed
- All team logos and text displays correctly

title: Verify - Scores: Calendar View Navigation
custom_preconds: NHL.TV app has been installed
custom_steps:
1. Launch the NHL.TV app
2. Select Scores from the main menu
3. Highlight and click the current date to go into Calendar view
custom_expected:
• The calendar and dates are displayed correctly
• Active and past dates are displayed correctly
• Swiping left highlights games to the left
• Swiping right highlight games to the right
• Past dates cannot be navigated to
• Click on any day to bring up the Scores view
• The number of games listed matches the number on the Calendar view

title: Verify - Scores: Sorting and grouping
custom_preconds:
NHL app installed
Logged in with specific teams Favorited and Followed
custom_steps: 1. Open the Scores view
custom_expected:
Games are to be grouped by type and types in a specific order:
Favorite/Followed team(s) first, Live games next, Scheduled games after, Final games after, and other (postponed) last

title: Verify - Highlights: User is able to launch highlights from the feed menu
custom_preconds: the NHL.TV app has been installed

2. Select Scores from the Main Menu

custom_expected:

- Highlights display the correct text
- Thumbnails display
- Scores and Team logos appear at the top of the screen (unless scores are turned off, then only logos appear)

*Note: Highlight will appear on the feed tab even when hide scores is turned on

title: Verify - Game Recap: User us able to launch the Game Recap from the feed menu

2. Select Scores from the main menu
3. Select a VOD game that has a Game Recap
4. Select the Game Recap
custom_expected:

- When hide scores is off, user will see score in title
 - When hide scores is ON, user will not see score in title
- Thumbnail image appears
- All text displays without any issues

title: Verify - Extended Highlight: User is able to launch the Extended highlight from the feed menu

4. Select the Extended Highlight from the game feed page
custom_expected:

- Thumbnail appears
- There are no issues with the txt

title: Verify - Standings: Navigation of the Standings Page
custom_preconds: the NHL.TV app has been installed
custom_steps:
1. Launch the NHL.TV app
2. Select Standing from the main menu
3. Navigate using by swiping left and right on the Apple Remote
custom_expected:
- User will land in the Division Standings view
- Each division will display the team, GP, RECORD, PTS and ROW
- Divisions will appear in the following order: Atlantic, Metropolitan, Central and Pacific
- Wild Card Standings appear in the following order: 
• Atlantic             • Wild Card
• Metropolitan

• Central             • Wild Card
• Pacific

title: Verify - Scores Navigation
custom_preconds:
App installed
On-boarding process is completed
Scores is selected and games are displayed
custom_steps:
1. Highlight the current date on the Scores menu
2. Scroll up on the Apple Remote

Additional test

1. Highlight the farthest Left or Right games in the top row
2. Scroll up on the Apple Remote
custom_expected:
Whenever you go to a tab bar option (noted by underlined text), it'll focus on the underlined item, not the item directly above where you're coming from.  
e.g., on Scores, when you're on the date and go up, it'll focus on Scores, not on Settings

Additional test:
Scrolling up from the furthest left or right games, the date becomes highlights, not the arrows pointing in either direction.

title: Verify - Videos Navigation
custom_preconds:
App installed
On-boarding process is completed
Scores is selected and games are displayed
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to Videos section
2. Scroll down to the first row, highlight the third video in the row
3. Scroll down to the second row, do not scroll left or right
4. Scroll down to the third row, highlight the second video in the row
5. From this point, scroll back up completely
custom_expected:
When traveling up and down through each section, the app will remember the last item you tried focusing on in that section and will bring focus back to that item.  
If you haven't visited the section, it defaults to the first item in the row.

THEN presses select to ENTER and PLAY the FGOTD media content
custom_expected: Playback will be initiated for any/all available FGOTD Live/VOD archive file(s)

AND the game media content file will play without issue

custom_steps:

title: Verify - Full VOD Archive Playback to Exit
custom_preconds: GIVEN we have accessed the "NHL.TV" application
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch ANY ARCHIVE/VOD video feed with a TRT > 2mins
AND watch to completion
custom_expected:
THEN playback will commence and continue without stalls or skips
AND the user will not be kicked out of the stream unexpectedly
AND upon completion the app will return to Schedule (asset) page

title: Verify - Full Live Game Linear Playback to Exit
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the "NHL.TV" application
AND the USER is signed in with a Premium Monthly OR Yearly account entitlement
custom_steps:

title: Verify - Video playback states

App installed

title: Verify - Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations
Verify - Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement

Verify - Dual Video UI appears correctly
custom_preconds:
• App installed onto tvOS device
• Logged in with entitled account
• Active game stream playing (live or archived)
custom_steps: 1. During fullscreen game stream, press the **Menu** button on the tvOS remote.
custom_expected:
All of the following appear as described below:

• Mini-scoreboard appears at the top of the video stream.
• Linescore (with correct score, team logos and team names) appears to the left of the video stream.
• Date of game and logos of other games that day appear along the bottom of the screen.
• Highlight the active game stream and swiping right brings up the "Select a Second Game" option
• All logos and game information (score, time, period, SOG) appears and updates correctly.

title: Verify - Simultaneous video play
custom_preconds:
• App installed onto tvOS device
• Logged in with entitled account
• Active game stream playing (live or archived)
custom_steps:
1. During fullscreen game stream, press the **Menu button** on the tvOS remote.
2. Swipe right to highlight the "Select a Second Game" window
3. Immediately swipe down and select an available game 
4. Select a stream option
custom_expected:
• User is returned to Dual Video view and can simultaneously see both games playing.
• Second game Linescore appears to the right of the game stream

title: Verify - Game audio
custom_preconds:
• App installed onto tvOS device
• Logged in with entitled account
• Dual Video game streams playing (live or archived)
custom_steps:
1. At the Dual Video UI, highlight and focus one of the two games.
2. After a few moments, highlight and focus on the other one.
custom_expected: While both games will visually play actively, only the audio for the focused game will be heard.

title: Verify - Play/Pause functionality on tvOS remote
custom_preconds:
• App installed onto tvOS device
• Logged in with entitled account
• Dual Video game streams playing (live or archived)
custom_steps:
1. Highlight and focus on one of the games playing
2. Press the Play/Pause button once, then again.
3. Repeat for the other game stream
custom_expected: The focused game will Play or Pause without issue.

title: Verify - Cold launch, logged out
custom_preconds:
• Install (either via sideloading or TestFlight) the app that you would like to test onto the same Apple TV.
• Sideload Linker.ipa onto a MLBAM-provisioned Apple TV running tvOS 10 or newer.
custom_steps:
1. Launch Linker.ipa
   2. Enter a deep link URL that matches the format that Siri has defined.
   3. Press Enter on a keyboard highlight and click the "Open" button on Linker.ipa

Siri Sports Tune-In sends deep links of the following format: **<app>://play?gameId=<leagueId><yyyymmdd><awayteamcode><hometeamcode><game_number>**

**app:** This is the primary URL scheme that the app responds to (e.g., nhl for NHL). This is defined by the app and is usually an appropriate abbreviation or acronym.

**leagueId:** This is the league identifier for the game (e.g., minbb_afl for the Arizona Fall League), primarily used to differentiate teams as team codes are only league-unique and not globally unique. For all apps, this is defined by Apple (see the attached spreadsheet below).

**yyyymmdd:** This is the date on which the game takes place in yyyyMMdd format (e.g., 20160409 for April 9, 2016).

**awayteamcode** and **hometeamcode:** These are the short codes for the away and home team (e.g., phx for the Arizona Coyotes), respectively. For all apps, this is defined by Apple (see the attached spreadsheet below) and may not match what the league defines as the short code. Apps should account for this possible discrepancy.

**game_number:** This is the desired game number amongst all games with the exact same values for all of the above parameters, primarily used for doubleheaders (e.g., 2 for the night game of a day-night doubleheader). Note: If two teams play each other twice in the same day but each team hosts one game (e.g., split-squad games), then both games will be numbered 1 because the two games' away_team_code and home_team_code technically differ.

Apple League Identifier and Team Code Reference Spreadsheet can be found at https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/Siri+Sports+Tune-In#SiriSportsTune-In-OtherResources
custom_expected: Cold launch, not logged in: App launches; user encounters paywall and cannot view content.

• Install (either via sideloading or TestFlight) the app that you would like to test onto the same Apple TV.

• Log into App with an un-entitled account, then Force Close the app

For all apps, this is defined by Apple (see the attached spreadsheet below) and may not match what the league defines as the short code. Apps should account for this possible discrepancy.

Note: If two teams play each other twice in the same day but each team hosts one game (e.g., split-squad games), then both games will be numbered 1 because the two games' away_team_code and home_team_code technically differ.
